  • Method Details

    • validate

      public void validate() throws DatalogException
      Checks whether a rule is valid. There are a variety of reasons why a rule may not be valid:
      • Each variable in the head of the rule must appear in the body.
      • Each variable in the body of a rule should appear at least once in a positive (that is non-negated) expression.
      • Variables that are used in built-in predicates must appear at least once in a positive expression.
      Throws:
      DatalogException - if the rule is not valid, with the reason in the message.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • substitute

      public Rule substitute​(Map<String,​String> bindings)
      Creates a new Rule with all variables from bindings substituted. eg. a Rule p(X,Y) :- q(X),q(Y),r(X,Y) with bindings {X:aa} will result in a new Rule p(aa,Y) :- q(aa),q(Y),r(aa,Y)
      Parameters:
      bindings - The bindings to substitute.
      Returns:
      the Rule with the substituted bindings.
